Constructor Detail

Game

public Game()
Class constructor. The entry point in to the client application. Creates the welcome screen [SplashWindow], sets up communication services, loads lobby window, and then drops the player in to the game, and gives them control of a ship in the game world.

Method Detail

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draw the various components in the game. The order of drawing is significant, in order to make sure that no GUI HUD elements or ships are obscured by weather or interface/map elements

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - Graphics object that is used to draw all/most 'things' in the game world

update

public void update()
Updates the various components in the game Unlike paint(), order is not significant for this method.

actionPerformed

Determines which action is being performed, and how to respond to it

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

e - ActionEvent object that is generated by interaction with an interface element. Typically button clicks.

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent pEvent)
Responds to a KeyEvent. Not used or implemented

Specified by:
keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
Parameters:
pEvent - KeyEvent to respond to.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent pEvent)
Responds to a KeyEvent by creating a [request] message to be sent to the server. The KeyEvents generated/watched for here are keyboard commands to change speed, fire, steer, and cycle between targets.

Specified by:
keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
Parameters:
pEvent - User generated KeyEvent to respond to.

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent pEvent)
Responds to a KeyEvent. Commented out by default. This method is used to echo to System.out the request message being sent to the server.

Specified by:
keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
Parameters:
pEvent - KeyEvent to respond to.

handleMessage

public void handleMessage(Message pMessage)
Responds to an incoming message. The possible incoming messages, and their effects, are defined in the NECS specification.

Specified by:
handleMessage in interface MessageListener
Parameters:
pMessage - The message that Communication received, and may result in a change to the game world
